snippet.textDisplay:
My song:
I walk all alone, through this blizzardly cold snow. I want to know, if my friends will be at the end.. waiting for me to. I don't know what to do.. I wonder if this is it, did my mind go and explode within? I think there's this passion with me making me want my friends I want to see.. And think on who they are. They went and called for help from this unknown star.. I will do what it takes. To make sure they're safe! I don't care about the cold,  I want to go and want the truth untold..
snippet.textOriginal:
My song:

They went and called for help from this unknown star.. I will do what it takes. To make sure they're safe! I don't care about the cold,  I want to go and want the truth untold..

snippet.textDisplay: I remember being disappointed when the new arrangement in Smash Bros. for Wii U read "Onett/ Winters Theme" and they played "Snowman" instead. Don't get me wrong, I love that track (maybe even a little more than this one) but it was already included. That's still one of my favorite new arrangements in Smash but I would have loved to see some more Earthbound music represented.
snippet.textOriginal: I remember being disappointed when the new arrangement in Smash Bros. for Wii U read "Onett/ Winters Theme" and they played "Snowman" instead. Don't get me wrong, I love that track (maybe even a little more than this one) but it was already included. That's still one of my favorite new arrangements in Smash but I would have loved to see some more Earthbound music represented.

snippet.textDisplay: .. Fuck, now I need to go play earthbound again. YOU WIN THIS TIME NINTENDO! In all seriousness though, this song is a masterpiece. It conveys so much emotion, and perfectly fits that area of the game. It's a bit lonely and sad, in a semi depressing/hopeful way, Like you're dreaming to escape your mundane life, but then reality sinks in. However you remain hopeful that maybe someday you'll go on grand adventures (Like the ones in this very game, for example..), make new friends, and escape the monotony of everyday life. And all in 16-bit! There's no doubt that this song is really good.
snippet.textOriginal: .. Fuck, now I need to go play earthbound again. YOU WIN THIS TIME NINTENDO! In all seriousness though, this song is a masterpiece. It conveys so much emotion, and perfectly fits that area of the game. It's a bit lonely and sad, in a semi depressing/hopeful way, Like you're dreaming to escape your mundane life, but then reality sinks in. However you remain hopeful that maybe someday you'll go on grand adventures (Like the ones in this very game, for example..), make new friends, and escape the monotony of everyday life. And all in 16-bit! There's no doubt that this song is really good.

snippet.textDisplay: Having a unique game like earthbound doesn't mean it's overrated by the fans. I've played earthbound just 1 month ago and I already know that out of all the games I've played so far this has to be the greatest one. If we're gonna talk about overrated game why don't we mention our modern "great" shooters such as CoD,BF,Halo and all of the 3rd person shooters too. And Nintendo games are good for more mature people, it's kids saying that Nintendo games are for kids, where's the logic in that?

snippet.textDisplay:
as a fan of Earthbound, i'll admit, gameplay-wise, it hasn't exactly aged spectacularly. parts of it can be a little tedious by today's standards.

but man, you can't beat the charm of the whole Earthbound Experience(tm). it still makes me feel all the feels i felt as a kid, and it's not just because of nostalgia. that's the game succeeding where it counts; RPG battles be damned.
snippet.textOriginal:
as a fan of Earthbound, i'll admit, gameplay-wise, it hasn't exactly aged spectacularly. parts of it can be a little tedious by today's standards.

but man, you can't beat the charm of the whole Earthbound Experience(tm). it still makes me feel all the feels i felt as a kid, and it's not just because of nostalgia. that's the game succeeding where it counts; RPG battles be damned.

snippet.textDisplay: Such great memories.  I really hate to sound like a fanboy, but I'm glad that I took the time to pay attention to this game. snippet.textDisplay:
This definitely held more weight with me when it came out as a child. Chrono Trigger has its own charm, but RPG or not, EarthBound held WAY more memories. It seems to be a diamond in the rough in comparison. Either way, EarthBound was the underdog; however, it held WAY more memories for me like I said. 

Both were good games though. I guess I was drawn elsewhere while everyone else was all crazy about CT. lol I never have been into the highly energetic, DBZ style stuff.
snippet.textOriginal:
This definitely held more weight with me when it came out as a child. Chrono Trigger has its own charm, but RPG or not, EarthBound held WAY more memories. It seems to be a diamond in the rough in comparison. Either way, EarthBound was the underdog; however, it held WAY more memories for me like I said. 

Both were good games though. I guess I was drawn elsewhere while everyone else was all crazy about CT. lol I never have been into the highly energetic, DBZ style stuff.
